g4901.definition: [συνεπιμαρτυρέω] from {{g4862}} and {{g1957}}; to testify further jointly, i.e. unite in adding evidence

g4902.definition: [συνέπομαι] middle voice from {{g4862}} and a primary ἕπω (to follow); to attend (travel) in company with

g4903.definition: [συνεργέω] from {{g4904}}; to be a fellow-worker, i.e. co-operate

g4904.definition: [συνεργός] from a presumed compound of {{g4862}} and the base of {{g2041}}; a co-laborer, i.e. coadjutor

g4905.definition: [συνέρχομαι] from {{g4862}} and {{g2064}}; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or (specially), cohabit (conjugally)

g4906.definition: [συνεσθίω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2068}} (including its alternate); to take food in company with

g4907.definition: [σύνεσις] from {{g4920}}; a mental putting together, i.e. intelligence or (concretely) the intellect

g4908.definition: [συνετός] from {{g4920}}; mentally put (or putting) together, i.e. sagacious Compare {{g5429}}.

g4909.definition: [συνευδοκέω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2106}}; to think well of in common, i.e. assent to, feel gratified with

g4910.definition: [συνευωχέω] from {{g4862}} and a derivative of a presumed compound of {{g2095}} and a derivative of {{g2192}} (meaning to be in good condition, i.e. (by implication) to fare well, or feast); to entertain sumptuously in company with, i.e. (middle voice or passive) to revel together

g4911.definition: [συνεφίστημι] from {{g4862}} and {{g2186}}; to stand up together, i.e. to resist (or assault) jointly

g4912.definition: [συνέχω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2192}}; to hold together, i.e. to compress (the ears, with a crowd or siege) or arrest (a prisoner); figuratively, to compel, perplex, afflict, preoccupy

g4913.definition: [συνήδομαι] middle voice from {{g4862}} and the base of {{g2237}}; to rejoice in with oneself, i.e. feel satisfaction concerning

g4914.definition: [συνήθεια] from a compound of {{g4862}} and {{g2239}}; mutual habituation, i.e. usage

g4915.definition: [συνηλικιώτης] from {{g4862}} and a derivative of {{g2244}}; a co-aged person, i.e. alike in years

g4916.definition: [συνθάπτω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2290}}; to inter in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to assimilate spiritually (to Christ by a sepulture as to sin)

g4917.definition: [συνθλάω] from {{g4862}} and thlao (to crush); to dash together, i.e. shatter

g4918.definition: [συνθλίβω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2346}}; to compress, i.e. crowd on all sides

g4919.definition: [συνθρύπτω] from {{g4862}} and θρύπτω (to crumble); to crush together, i.e. (figuratively) to dispirit

g4920.definition: [συνίημι] from {{g4862}} and ἵημι (to send); to put together, i.e. (mentally) to comprehend; by implication, to act piously

g4921.definition: [συνιστάω] ,   or (strengthened)      συνιστάνω,   or      συνίστημιfrom {{g4862}} and {{g2476}} (including its collateral forms); to set together, i.e. (by implication) to introduce (favorably), or (figuratively) to exhibit; intransitively, to stand near, or (figuratively) to constitute

g4922.definition: [συνοδεύω] from {{g4862}} and {{g3593}}; to travel in company with

g4923.definition: [συνοδία] from a compound of {{g4862}} and {{g3598}} ("synod"); companionship on a journey, i.e. (by implication), a caravan

g4924.definition: [συνοικέω] from {{g4862}} and {{g3611}}; to reside together (as a family)

g4925.definition: [συνοικοδομέω] from {{g4862}} and {{g3618}}; to construct, i.e. (passively) to compose (in company with other Christians, figuratively)

g4927.definition: [συνομορέω] from {{g4862}} and a derivative of a compound of the base of 3674 and the base of {{g3725}}; to border together, i.e. adjoin

g4929.definition: [συντάσσω] from {{g4862}} and {{g5021}}; to arrange jointly, i.e. (figuratively) to direct

g4930.definition: [συντέλεια] from {{g4931}}; entire completion, i.e. consummation (of a dispensation)

g4931.definition: [συντελέω] from {{g4862}} and {{g5055}}; to complete entirely; generally, to execute (literally or figuratively)

g4932.definition: [συντέμνω] from {{g4862}} and the base of {{g5114}}; to contract by cutting, i.e. (figuratively) do concisely (speedily)

g4933.definition: [συντηρέω] from {{g4862}} and {{g5083}}; to keep closely together, i.e. (by implication) to conserve (from ruin); mentally, to remember (and obey)

g4934.definition: [συντίθεμαι] middle voice from {{g4862}} and {{g5087}}; to place jointly, i.e. (figuratively) to consent (bargain, stipulate), concur

g4935.definition: [συντόμως] adverb from a derivative of {{g4932}}; concisely (briefly)

g4936.definition: [συντρέχω] from {{g4862}} and {{g5143}} (including its alternate); to rush together (hastily assemble) or headlong (figuratively)

g4937.definition: [συντρίβω] from {{g4862}} and the base of {{g5147}}; to crush completely, i.e. to shatter (literally or figuratively)

g4938.definition: [σύντριμμα] from {{g4937}}; concussion or utter fracture (properly, concretely), i.e. complete ruin

g4939.definition: [σύντροφος] from {{g4862}} and {{g5162}} (in a passive sense); a fellow-nursling, i.e. comrade

g4940.definition: [συντυγχάνω] from {{g4862}} and {{g5177}}; to chance together, i.e. meet with (reach)

g4941.definition: [Συντύχη] from {{g4940}}; an accident; Syntyche, a Christian female

g4942.definition: [συνυποκρίνομαι] from {{g4862}} and {{g5271}}; to act hypocritically in concert with

g4943.definition: [συνυπουργέω] from {{g4862}} and a derivative of a compound of {{g5259}} and the base of {{g2041}}; to be a co-auxiliary, i.e. assist

g4944.definition: [συνωδίνω] from {{g4862}} and {{g5605}}; to have (parturition) pangs in company (concert, simultaneously) with, i.e. (figuratively) to sympathize (in expectation of relief from suffering)

g4945.definition: [συνωμοσία] from a compound of {{g4862}} and {{g3660}}; a swearing together, i.e. (by implication) a plot

g4946.definition: [Συράκουσαι] plural of uncertain derivation; Syracuse, the capital of Sicily

g4947.definition: [Συρία] probably of Hebrew origin ({{h6865}}); Syria (i.e. Tsyria or Tyre), a region of Asia

g4948.definition: [Σύρος] from the same as {{g4947}}; a Syran (i.e. probably Tyrian), a native of Syria

g4949.definition: [Συροφοίνισσα] feminine of a compound of {{g4948}} and the same as {{g5403}}; a Syro-phœnician woman, i.e. a female native of Phœnicia in Syria

g4950.definition: [σύρτις] from {{g4951}}; a shoal (from the sand drawn thither by the waves), i.e. the Syrtis Major or great bay on the north coast of Africa

g4952.definition: [συσπαράσσω] from {{g4862}} and {{g4682}}; to rend completely, i.e. (by analogy) to convulse violently

g4953.definition: [σύσσημον] neuter of a compound of {{g4862}} and the base of {{g4591}}; a sign in common, i.e. preconcerted signal

g4954.definition: [σύσσωμος] from {{g4862}} and {{g4983}}; of a joint body, i.e. (figuratively) a fellow-member of the Christian community

g4955.definition: [συστασιαστής] from a compound of {{g4862}} and a derivative of {{g4714}}; a fellow-insurgent

g4956.definition: [συστατικός] from a derivative of {{g4921}}; introductory, i.e. recommendatory

g4957.definition: [συσταυρόω] from {{g4862}} and {{g4717}}; to impale in company with (literally or figuratively)

g4958.definition: [συστέλλω] from {{g4862}} and {{g4724}}; to send (draw) together, i.e. enwrap (enshroud a corpse for burial), contract (an interval)

g4959.definition: [συστενάζω] from {{g4862}} and {{g4727}}; to moan jointly, i.e. (figuratively) experience a common calamity

g4960.definition: [συστοιχέω] from {{g4862}} and {{g4748}}; to file together (as soldiers in ranks), i.e. (figuratively) to correspond to

g4961.definition: [συστρατιώτης] from {{g4862}} and {{g4757}}; a co-campaigner, i.e. (figuratively) an associate in Christian toil

g4962.definition: [συστρέφω] from {{g4862}} and {{g4762}}; to twist together, i.e. collect (a bundle, a crowd)

g4963.definition: [συστροφή] from {{g4962}}; a twisting together, i.e. (figuratively) a secret coalition, riotous crowd

g4964.definition: [συσχηματίζω] from {{g4862}} and a derivative of {{g4976}}; to fashion alike, i.e. conform to the same pattern (figuratively)

g4965.definition: [Συχάρ] of Hebrew origin ({{h7941}}); Sychar (i.e. Shekar), a place in Palestine

g4966.definition: [Συχέμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h7927}}); Sychem (i.e. Shekem), the name of a Canaanite and of a place in Palestine

g4967.definition: [σφαγή] from {{g4969}}; butchery (of animals for food or sacrifice, or (figuratively) of men (destruction))

g4968.definition: [σφάγιον] neuter of a derivative of {{g4967}}; a victim (in sacrifice)

g4969.definition: [σφάζω] a primary verb; to butcher (especially an animal for food or in sacrifice) or (generally) to slaughter, or (specially), to maim (violently)

g4970.definition: [σφόδρα] neuter plural of σφοδρός (violent; of uncertain derivation) as adverb; vehemently, i.e. in a high degree, much

g4971.definition: [σφοδρῶς] adverb from the same as {{g4970}}; very much

g4972.definition: [σφραγίζω] from {{g4973}}; to stamp (with a signet or private mark) for security or preservation (literally or figuratively); by implication, to keep secret, to attest

g4973.definition: [σφραγίς] probably strengthened from {{g5420}}; a signet (as fencing in or protecting from misappropriation); by implication, the stamp impressed (as a mark of privacy, or genuineness), literally or figuratively

g4974.definition: [σφυρόν] neuter of a presumed derivative probably of the same as σφαῖρα (a ball, "sphere"; compare the feminine σφῦρα, a hammer); the ankle (as globular)

g4975.definition: [σχεδόν] neuter of a presumed derivative of the alternate of {{g2192}} as adverb; nigh, i.e. nearly

g4976.definition: [σχῆμα] from the alternate of {{g2192}}; a figure (as a mode or circumstance), i.e. (by implication) external condition

g4977.definition: [σχίζω] apparently a primary verb; to split or sever (literally or figuratively)

g4978.definition: [σχίσμα] from {{g4977}}; a split or gap ("schism"), literally or figuratively

g4979.definition: [σχοινίον] diminutive of σχοῖνος (a rush or flag-plant; of uncertain derivation); a rushlet, i.e. grass-withe or tie (generally)

g4980.definition: [σχολάζω] from {{g4981}}; to take a holiday, i.e. be at leisure for (by implication, devote oneself wholly to); figuratively, to be vacant (of a house)

g4981.definition: [σχολή] probably feminine of a presumed derivative of the alternate of {{g2192}}; properly, loitering (as a withholding of oneself from work) or leisure, i.e. (by implication) a "school" (as vacation from physical employment)

g4982.definition: [σώζω] from a primary σῶς (contraction for obsolete σάος, "safe"); to save, i.e. deliver or protect (literally or figuratively)

g4983.definition: [σῶμα] from {{g4982}}; the body (as a sound whole), used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively

g4986.definition: [Σώπατρος] from the base of {{g4982}} and {{g3962}}; of a safe father; Sopatrus, a Christian Compare {{g4989}}.

g4987.definition: [σωρεύω] from another form of {{g4673}}; to pile up (literally or figuratively)

g4988.definition: [Σωσθένης] from the base of {{g4982}} and that of {{g4599}}; of safe strength; Sosthenes, a Christian

g4990.definition: [σωτήρ] from {{g4982}}; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ

g4991.definition: [σωτηρία] feminine of a derivative of {{g4990}} as (properly, abstract) noun; rescue or safety (physically or morally)

g4992.definition: [σωτήριον] neuter of the same as {{g4991}} as (properly, concretely) noun; defender or (by implication) defence

g4993.definition: [σωφρονέω] from {{g4998}}; to be of sound mind, i.e. sane, (figuratively) moderate

g4994.definition: [σωφρονίζω] from {{g4998}}; to make of sound mind, i.e. (figuratively) to discipline or correct

g4996.definition: [σωφρόνως] adverb from {{g4998}}; with sound mind, i.e. moderately

g4997.definition: [σωφροσύνη] from {{g4998}}; soundness of mind, i.e. (literally) sanity or (figuratively) self-control

g4998.definition: [σώφρων] from the base of {{g4982}} and that of {{g5424}}; safe (sound) in mind, i.e. self-controlled (moderate as to opinion or passion)

g4999.definition: [Ταβέρναι] plural of Latin origin; huts or wooden-walled buildings; Tabernæ

g5000.definition: [Ταβιθά] of Chaldee origin (compare {{h6646}}); the gazelle; Tabitha (i.e. Tabjetha), a Christian female
